titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Gennadiĭ Ivanovich Tupit͡syn papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lyalya Kharitonova

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-21T17:22-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, printed matter, postcards, and photographs relating to the promotion of Esperanto, especially in Latvia and the Soviet Union.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Gennadiĭ Ivanovich Tupit͡syn papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2005.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Gennadiĭ Ivanovich Tupit͡syn was a Russian Esperantist, linguist, and teacher. He was also an active member of the Latvian Esperanto Society and the Universal Esperanto Association (UEA).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers consist mostly of correspondence relating to Tupit͡syn's Esperanto teaching activities. Additional materials include writings and printed matter concerning promotion of Esperanto, especially in Latvia and the Soviet Union.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes "Enketo" by G. Tupitsyn and a note by B. Rozenfeld.

did.unittitle: Invitations to participate in Esperanto conferences, seminars, and talks,
Latvian and Estonian Esperanto Society, group portraits,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs depicting G. Tupitsyn with Society members.

did.unittitle: Tartu Esperanto language conference participants, Estonia,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes short articles, notes, and drafts.

did.unittitle: "Cu la libro ne estas mirarklo?," typescript,
"Mia reports en la Balta kongreso esperantista en Rigo, Kastels," speeches, typescripts,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes notes, drafts, and requests for the dictionary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes notes, drafts, and printed matter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes leaflets, newsletters, calendars, and clippings.

did.unittitle: "Nia Informilo," Instrua kaj literatura gazeto, Eldono de la Esperanto-Instituto Isosek,
Enciklopedia Vortaro Esperanta-German, unia-kvara parto, by Eugen Wuster, Leipzig,
